discourse_list.title: [\xf0\x9f\x93\x84] Collateral Onboarding Call #21: RWA 2020 Wrap-up & RWA-2021 + 3 Asset Originators - Wednesday, December 16 18:00 UTC

content.content: collateral211280×720 151 KB “Is there a character limit in the title field?” Time in your local-timezone format: 2020-12-16T18:00:00Z Dial In Details Zoom Call Passcode: RWA-WG Intro An open discussion where we discuss projects and potential assets for MCD, open for anyone to join. If you’d like to present, check out this thread Agenda Intro by  @juanjuan RWA Comment by @sebventures  Progress Summary Next steps  Centrifuge  Progress during 2020 2021: Objectives and Roadmap  Harbor Trade Credit (https://harbortradecredit.com/)  MIP6: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/htc-drop-mip6-application-harbor-trade-credit-drop-short-term-trade-receivables/3502)  Peoples Company (https://peoplescompany.com/)  MIP6: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/p1-drop-mip6-application-peoples-company-drop-us-agricultural-real-estate/5518   Fortunafi (https://www.fortunafi.com/) See you there! attn: @SebVentures  ; @amyjung; @blimpa ; @_LS ; @spin ; @Primoz  ; @mrabino1 ; @alexis ; @flipflopflapdelegate ; @g_dip

Collateral Call Summary - Episode #21  December 17th, 2020 Agenda   00:00: Intro with Juan Guillén  00:56: RWA status update with Sébastien Derivaux  03:54: Centrifuge update with Lea Schmitt  09:40: Harbor Trade Credit with Blake Coler-Dark, Rana S. Mookherjee, Bryan Maloney and Martin  20:54: Q&A and Discussion about Harbor Trade Credit  32:57: Peoples Company with Mark Moore and Bruce Sherrick  50:04: Fortunafi with Nick Garcia  Video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6R3Px59h2z4 Introduction Juan Guillén Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Welcome to the last Collateral Onboarding Call of 2020, in this case RWA. We are very excited about everything that happened in this last couple of months.  @sebventures is going to be speaking about that. After that we’re going to have an introduction by @LS_ from Centrifuge Then we’re going to have three assets originators talking about the product: Harbor Trade Credit, Peoples Company and Fortunafi. Discussions about collateral happen in the Forum.   RWA status  Posts tagged real-world-assets  Sébastien Derivaux Presentation 00:56 RWA Status1920×1080 203 KB Centrifuge update  Centrifuge: Onboarding RWA Backed Collateral to MCD  Lea Schmitt Presentation 03:54 Lea Schmitt1920×1080 66.5 KB Harbor Trade Credit  [HTC-DROP] MIP6 Application: Harbor Trade Credit DROP: Short Term Trade Receivables  Blake Coler-Dark, Rana S. Mookherjee, Bryan Maloney and Martin Presentation 09:40 Harbor Trade Credit 01920×1080 84.3 KB Our team1920×1080 216 KB Innovative asset classes1920×1080 206 KB Harbor Trade Credit 11920×1080 213 KB Harbor Trade Credit 21920×1080 166 KB Client focus1920×1080 172 KB Cash conversion cycle1920×1080 246 KB Harbor supply chain finance solution1920×1080 217 KB Discussion  20:54 - Lea: Can you share a little bit on what pool size you’re working on and what you intend to originate in the next six to twelve months? What are your plans to grow it? 23:38 - Lea (reading from chat): Can you introduce where they fit and how they intereact with the actors of the value chain, freight carriers, customs, et cetera? 25:33 - Gregory Di Prisco: Where do you demonstrate your underwriting standards and how can the Maker holders keep track of that? 27:55 - Gregory Di Prisco: What level of visibility would the Maker holders have into that through a Tinlake? Can we click on an individual loan and see all the details that you just described to me? 29:28 - Gregory Di Prisco: Do we have an approval mechanism for new loans entering the pool? How do we know that a horribly rated company is not going to be pushed into the pool? What’s the blocker mechanism there? 32:24 - Juan Guillén: How often are the prices updated?  Peoples Company  [P1-DROP] MIP6 Application: Peoples Company DROP: US Agricultural Real Estate  Mark Moore and Bruce Sherrick Presentation 32:57 Mark Moore1920×1080 56.9 KB Bruce Sherrick1920×1080 103 KB Balance sheet of Ag sector -- US1920×1080 299 KB Balance shee of US Ag sector1920×1080 219 KB Farmland returns in context 01920×1080 297 KB Farmland returns in context 11920×1080 184 KB U.S. AG returns1920×1080 207 KB Farmland returns minus inflation1920×1080 245 KB Do farm assets behave like...?1920×1080 291 KB Fortunafi Nick Garcia Presentation Nick Garcia1920×1080 82.6 KB Fortunafi1920×1080 75.5 KB Team1920×1080 150 KB Why RBF assets?1920×1080 112 KB Revenue based financing (RBF)1920×1080 209 KB Growing asset class1920×1080 130 KB CORL - Asset Originator Partnet1920×1080 216 KB CORL - Underwriting Report1920×1080 228 KB Thank you1920×1080 90.7 KB Discussion 59:30 - Jason Jones: Is the profile of the companies that you try to fund mostly high-recurring revenue-type companies? 01:00:14 - Phil: How do you define the sell-off price, the 1x-3x? Closing Comment Juan Guillén Outro 01:01:47  I want to be mindful of people’s times. Let’s keep the conversation going in the forum. I think all your names are there. I don’t know, Seb, if you want to mention something before closing (01:02:08). Thanks again to Harbor Trade, Fortunafi and Peoples Company. It was great having you guys. See you next year and have a great holiday.  Credits   @blimpa produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
Great meeting with unique RWAs - thank you. Happy holidays everyone!
Great wrap up - Recording is up!
